snippet: The country plans a new issue of three-year bonds in an attempt to capitalize on the growing demand for short-term euro-zone debt.
abstract: Greece says that it is planning to sell bonds again in effort to capitalize on growing demand for short-term euro zone debt, three months after returning to international bond markets following long exile.
lead_paragraph: The country plans a new issue of three-year bonds in an attempt to capitalize on the growing demand for short-term euro-zone debt.

headline.print_headline: Seeing Demand for Its Debt, Greece Plans Bond Offering
